comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: John E. Aldred was director of United Railways & Electric Co., Baltimore. Before that he was president of Consolidated Gas, Electric Light & Power in Baltimore, and the Pennsylvania Water & Power Co. He was also the Chairman of the Gillette Safety Razor Company. www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,846757,00.html They had a 40-room mansion on Long Island called Ormston House, built in 1910; today it's used as a monastery. www.ligoldcoast.com/liprivate.html en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_E._Aldred_Estate Here's a video of their house: www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rg8qR5Zlfrg Mr. & Mrs. Aldred had a daughter in March 1916.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Indicator Takes Meadow Brook Cup.Stirring Race for Hunt Trophy on Harry Payne Whitney's Estate at Wheatley Hills. Harry Payne Whitney played the part of an English country squire to perfection at his country place at Wheatley Hills yesterday, the occasion being the annual meeting of the Meadow Brook Steeplechase Association. For the farmers and their families in the vicinity Mr. Whitney provided an abundant lunch, and incidentally an opportunity to get enough out of "them city fellers" to buy all the fertilizers they will need for the coming year. Source: New York Times on May 10, 1914 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F10E14F7355D1373...
